intro: Euphrasia flavicans, commonly known as the yellow eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that resemble tiny eyes, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and meadows. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Euphrasia flavicans is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
